text:
Sawaddee ka, welcome to hot thai kitchen! so 
the dish i'm going to share with you today is

something i've been obsessed with ever since i 
discovered it because it's something so easy and

super fast yet it is so tasty especially if you 
love eggs it's something that in thai is called

"kai yoo yee" which literally means wrinkled eggs 
which doesn't sound the most appetizing so i am

going to call it marble eggs in english because 
that's kind of what it looks like super easy and

you will be surprised how good it is let's get 
started so the heart of this dish is actually

the sauce that goes on top of the eggs and it's 
something called prik nam pla which in thailand

is actually kind of like our salt and peppers 
just chilies and fish sauce that we use to put

to boost seasoning of just about anything but this 
recipe i'm going to show you has been fine-tuned

specifically for this dish okay starting with the 
nam pla or fish sauce and then i'm going to add

lime juice i'm going to add equal parts lime juice 
which is actually way more lime than the typical

prik nam pla but because i want to be able to put 
a lot of this stuff on the eggs i don't want it

to be too salty and i want it to have a sharp 
brightness so i'm doing extra lime here and i'm

just going to add a little bit of sugar to sort of 
round off the sharp salty and sourness you don't

typically add sugar into prik nam pla but again 
this is a special prik nam pla for this recipe

that will dissolve in no time now the "prik" in 
prik nam pla is chilies i have mine soaking in

water and that's my quick shortcut way of 
reducing the spiciness in chilies without

having to like scrape anything and as they sit 
the seeds will all fall to the bottom i'll show

you. you see this? and then as it sits in the 
water it'll also infuse some of the spiciness

into the water so that's like a shortcut way and 
the reason why i do this is because i want to be

able to add a lot of chilies to this because the 
flavor of the chilies actually go really well with

the eggs and if it's too spicy then i can't really 
you know have too much so this is a definitely a

dish that if you can't eat spicy don't add less 
chilies remove the heat out of the chilies to

add a little bit more complexity i'm going to add 
some garlic and shallots thinly sliced there is a

recipe but you can add really as much or as little 
as you like now you can use this right away but

ideally you want to let this sit for at least you 
know 15 minutes to allow the flavor of the garlic

and shallots to infuse and also as it sits it 
will sort of soften that raw bite of the garlic

and shallots as well this will keep in the fridge 
for a few days at least i mean it won't go bad but

it won't taste quite as good if you go more than 
a few days and now the most interesting part

of this thing the marble eggs this goes quick 
so you want to have your rice all ready to go

and i am using three large eggs in a 10 inch pan 
yes size does matter because that will determine

how thick or thin your eggs are at the end and 
i've determined that this is the optimal ratio

now preheat the pan nonstick is a good idea 
and i'm gonna add a little bit of oil i'm

telling you this is the hardest part of this 
whole recipe is waiting for the pan to heat up

i'm just gonna check my heat and i mean you 
can drizzle a little bit of egg whites in there

if there's some stuck on the spatula you can 
see whether it's bubbling around the spatula

where the egg is okay i think that's good it 
should be hot but it it you know it doesn't

have to be sizzly hot so in goes three eggs yeah 
that's good a little bit of slow will actually

buy you time to do this important thing so you 
want to get this roundish as much as possible

break the yolk and then you just sort of like 
"kia pai kia ma" you know like just drag it around

so that you create this marble 
effect so in fact if it's too hot

it'll kind of harden so quick that you won't have 
time to draw out your design as easily there we go

and that's it stop if you touch it too 
much then it just turns into scrambled

eggs and you lose that marbleness and as it's 
cooking if you see any sort of like a lot of

egg whites on top you can make a little hole 
to allow the runnier part on top to go under

this is great if you like sort of me over medium 
eggs which is always when i go get breakfast i'm

always like i'd like over medium eggs please and 
they never get it right but this will end up being

sort of like not super runny but not well done 
okay don't talk too much because you're gonna...
okay that's good i'm done and then go to the rice

and then i'm just gonna slide all this 
over the rice ready? one two three...

wow look at that now let's try to 
center this a bit look how easy that was

you could do this in an eight-inch pan but 
i found that then i don't have these sort of

rough edges which i like the look of 
that but if you want sort of thicker

eggs then yeah an eight-inch pan would be 
the way to go take our sauce and generously

just drizzle i've made this sauce mild enough that 
you can really go crazy with the sauce that is it

look how beautiful that is for something 
so simple and now if you want i think

a side of cucumber slices is a good idea 
so i've got some right here ready to go

just because you know there's not much 
freshness in there so any sort of raw

crunchy vegetables you've got in the fridge 
that'll work just fine let's give it a taste

i want to make sure you get 
some chilies in that bite

incredible what is mind-boggling about this is 
how simple this whole thing is yet how incredibly

satisfying it is the eggs are done just right and 
you've got the salty the sour and the spicy from

the pregnant pla so good now that sauce probably 
good for maybe four portions of this but if you

have left over just put it on anything like if 
you've got like a bowl of plain rice just drizzle

it and it'll be good this again is like our salt 
and pepper super versatile sauce so the recipe

as always will be on hathaikitchen.com not that 
you need a written recipe it's so easy but check

out the website post i always include extra tips 
that i didn't get a chance to include in the video

especially thanks to all of our patreon supporters 
who help support the show if you want to watch

my videos ad free and with bonus content check 
out what patreon is all about in the link below

thank you as always for watching and i will see 
you next time for your next delicious Thai meal.
